content.question: A newspaper article indicated that 43 percent of cars with black seats are white, 46 percent of cars with black seats are blue, 7 percent of cars with black seats are red, and 4 percent of cars with black seats are black. A test was conducted to investigate whether the color of cars with black seats was consistent with the newspaper article. A random sample of cars of these colors was selected, and the value of the chi-square test statistic was <math alttext="chi square equals 8.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>8.2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following represents the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>–value for the test?

choices.label: <math alttext="the probability of, chi square is greater than or equal to 8.2, equals 0.08" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo largeop="false" stretchy="false" symmetric="false">(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>≥</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>8.2</mn><mo largeop="false" stretchy="false" symmetric="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0.08</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the probability of, chi square is greater than or equal to 8.2, equals 0.04" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo largeop="false" stretchy="false" symmetric="false">(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>≥</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>8.2</mn><mo largeop="false" stretchy="false" symmetric="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0.04</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the probability of, chi square is less than or equal to 8.2, equals 0.96" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo largeop="false" stretchy="false" symmetric="false">(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>≤</mo><mn>8.2</mn><mo largeop="false" stretchy="false" symmetric="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0.96</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the probability of, chi square equals 8.2, equals 0.00" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>8.2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0.00</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
The <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value cannot be calculated because the sample size is not given.

content.answer: <math alttext="the probability of, chi square is greater than or equal to 8.2, equals 0.04" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo largeop="false" stretchy="false" symmetric="false">(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>≥</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>8.2</mn><mo largeop="false" stretchy="false" symmetric="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0.04</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 8.3: Carrying out a Chi-Square Goodness of Fit Test

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
